FRS_Method: GPS CODE (PSEUDO RANGE) STANDARD POSITION (SA OFF)

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary
Aqua Ohio
Stark Regional Division

In accordance with the EPA/RMP regulations, this is the documented management system for a Program 3 process wit a clear delineation of overall management responsibility for the program implementation and the lines of responsibility.  For all personnel, assigned responsibility for individual requirements, this plan identifies the persons responsible and is made up of four (4) major areas identified as the Management System, Hazard Assessment, Prevention Program and the Emergency Response Program.

The Hazard Assessment is made up of the worst case analysis and the alternate release analysis utilizing Degadis modeling.  Also included is a five (5) year accident history, with no accidental releases occurring at this facility during the past five (5) years.

The facility is a standard water treatment plant using chlorine as a disinfectant for potable water.  One (1) ton cylinders of chlorine exceeding a threshold inventory of 2500 pounds are stored in a separate enclosed building.  The worst case release scenario, identified in the hazard assessment, would be the release of the entire contents of a one (1) ton cylinder of chlorine gas.  This type of release would have an offsite impact of a 1.5 mile radius around the treatment facility.  The affected area includes residences, two (2) schools, and a hospital.  The alternate release scenarios would be a pin hole piping leak or a vacuum regulator leak with an offsite impact of .10 miles and .20 miles respectively.  The leak detection system includes audible alarms, strobe lights, report back to the central computer, and keyed interlocks of the exhaust system of the sealed chlorine facility.

The most comprehensive section of the RMP is the Prevention Program.  This section includes detailed information and procedures on Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Mechanical Integrity, Management of Change, Pre-Startup Review, Com

pliance Audits, Incident Investigations, Employee Participation Plan, Hot Work Permits, and Contractor Safety.

The last section of the RMP is entitled Emergency Response Plan. The purpose of this plan is to minimize the duration and the effects of an accidental release, thereby protecting public health and the environment.  Although the facility will not be first responders in the event of an accidental release the emergency plan details the procedures to follow and includes name and phone numbers of the responding parties.  

The electronic data elements fo the Executive Summary Section 1 entitled registration is make part of the Executive Summary.  The complete electronic filing is included in the appendix.
